SRI.P.S.BINU RESPONDENT/S: 1 C.M.VALSAN, AGED 46 YEARS S/O.CHATHU, EYYANKOD AMSOM AND DESOM, VATAKARA TALUK, KOZHIKODE DISTRICT, PIN-673513. 2 STATE OF KERALA, REPRESENTED BY THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM, PIN-682031. BY ADV. SRI.ZUBAIR PULIKKOOL OTHER PRESENT: SRI ALEX M THOMBRA- SR PUBLIC PROSECUTOR THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 09.01.2019, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: [OF 2019/KER/1023 Crl.MC.No. 173 of 2019 1.3.. ORDER Petition filed under Section 482 Cr.P.C. 2. The petitioners are the accused in Crime No. 64 of 2017 of Thottilpalam Police Station registered for the offences under Sections 143, 147, 153A & 342 r/w Section 149 of the Indian Penal Code. The first respondent is the victim. It is submitted that the matter has been settled and the proceedings in the criminal case may be quashed. 3. Heard the learned counsel for the petitioners and the first respondent and the learned Public Prosecutor. 4. I have perused the affidavit filed by the first respondent, who has entered appearance through counsel. I am satisfied that the allegation of settlement is true and no public interest is involved. There is no impediment for granting the prayer of the petitioners. In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed. The Beil Lape ob 2019/KER/1023 Crl.MC.No. 173 of 2019 14... proceedings in Crime No. 64 of 2017 of Thottilpalam Police Station are quashed. The learned magistrate may pass appropriate orders for the disposal of the material objects, if any, produced in the case. Sd/- K.ABRAHAM MATHEW JUDGE APPENDIX PETITIONER'S/S EXHIBITS: ANNEXURE 1 COPY OF THE F.I.R WITH F.I.S. IN CRIME NO.64/2017 OF THOTTIPALAM POLICE STATION. ANNEXURE 2 SWORN AFFIDAVIT OF FIRST RESPONDENT. Bka/10.01.2018
